Questions.Question: The field the populated with four game elements per alliance. Name three of them.
What is the source used for?
The speaker's subwoofer lights are on. What does this indicate?
How many traps are on the field?
The amp's coopertition light is blinking. What does this indicate?
Questions.Answer: It's auto or the initial 45 seconds of teleop and the alliance has not used a note for coopertition

Questions.Question: What is the maximum weight of a robot?
What is a robot's maximum frame perimeter?
What is a robot's maximum height?
What is the maximum length allowed to extend past a robot's frame perimeter?
What is the maximum number of propulsion motors allowed on a robot?
How many points does an amp note earn in both auto and teleop?
Notes can earn 5 point three different ways. Name two of them.
Questions.Answer:
Speaker note during autonomous
Speaker note when amplified
Trap note

Questions.Question: How is the ensemble ranking point earned?
Questions.Answer: At least 10 stage points and at least 2 onstage robots

Questions.Question: What is the match advantage of earning the coopertition bonus?
Questions.Answer: Only 15 amp and speaker notes are needed instead of 18 to earn the melody ranking point

Questions.Question: A robot consists of just a chassis (wheels) and nothing else. How many points can it possibly score on its own in a match?
Questions.Answer:
3 points:
2 points for leaving the robot starting zone in auto,
1 point for parking in the stage zone at the end of the match

Questions.Question: What is the maximum number of notes a robot may control at once?
When can a human player throw high notes onto the field?
Questions.Answer: During the last 20 seconds of the match

Questions.Question: What is the maximum amount of time a robot may pin an opponent's robot?
What does a tech foul entail?
At the beginning of a match, what is the maximum number of notes on the field?
Questions.Answer:
17 notes:
5 notes on the center line
6 notes on the wings
6 notes loaded in robots

Questions.Question: What must be worn around the playing field and in the pit area?
What does FIRST stand for?
Questions.Answer: For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology

Questions.Question: A human player throws a high note onto a microphone. What advantage does this provide?
Questions.Answer: Onstage robots under the microphone are spotlit and score more points (4 instead of 3)

Questions.Question: If two teams have the same number of ranking points, what is the next criteria used to rank them?
What is the maximum amount of stage points an alliance can earn?
Questions.Answer:
31 points:
5 + 5 + 5 trap points
4 + 4 + 4 onstage spotlit points
2 + 2 harmony points
